API Documentation

Overview

The SquirrelUno project is structured to facilitate easy understanding and extension. The core functionality is divided across several modules, each responsible for different aspects of the game. This documentation covers the primary entry points and key components of the project.

Console Entry Point

The console entry point, defined in __main__.py, handles the command-line interface (CLI) for SquirrelUno. This module allows users to interact with the game through various commands and options.

class uno.__main__.CLI[source]

Bases: object

Command Line Interface for Uno game.

handle_no_command(args)[source]

Handles the case when no command is provided.

parse_args()[source]

Parses the command-line arguments.

run()[source]

Runs the CLI and handles the parsed arguments.

version_info(args)[source]

Displays version information.

Script Entry

The script entry point, defined in __init__.py, initializes the SquirrelUno package and contains the main logic for starting the game. This module ensures that all necessary components are correctly set up and ready to use.

uno.ask_players()[source]

Prompts for player names and returns a list of players.

Returns:

List of player names.

Return type:

list

uno.clear_screen()[source]

Clears the terminal screen.

uno.display_creator_message()[source]

Displays the creator message on the screen.

uno.display_logo()[source]

Displays the UNO game logo.

uno.main(debug_active: bool)[source]

Main function to start the UNO game.

Parameters:

debug_active (bool) – Flag to activate debug mode.

uno.tutorial()[source]

Displays a tutorial for the UNO game.

Card Logic

The card_logic.py module defines the different types of cards and their behaviors in the SquirrelUno game. This includes number cards, joker cards, and special action cards like draw and reverse cards.

class uno.card_logic.Card(card_type: CardType)[source]

Bases: UIDObject

Base class for all cards.

clear_new_flag()[source]

Clears the new card flag.

get_stack_based_on_owner(owner_uid: str)[source]

Gets the stack based on the owner UID.

Parameters:

owner_uid (str) – The UID of the owner.

Returns:

The stack owned by the owner UID.

Return type:

Stack

set_new_card()[source]

Marks the card as new.

transfer_owner(owner_uid: str, other_uid: str, *, forced=False, new_card=False)[source]

Transfers the card to a new owner.

Parameters:

  • owner_uid (str) – The UID of the current owner.

  • other_uid (str) – The UID of the new owner.

  • forced (bool, optional) – If True, force the transfer. Defaults to False.

  • new_card (bool, optional) – If True, mark as new card. Defaults to False.

Shuffles the deck.

Parameters:

remain_last_card (bool, optional) – If True, the last card remains in place. Defaults to False.

Game Logic

The game_logic.py module manages the core game mechanics, including player actions, game flow, and turn management. It orchestrates the interactions between players and the deck of cards to simulate a game of Uno.

class uno.game_logic.GameMaster(players: list)[source]

Bases: UIDObject

Manages the overall game logic.

check_winner()[source]

Checks if there is a winner.

Returns:

The winning player if there is a winner, None otherwise.

Return type:

Player

game_cycle(first_round)[source]

Executes a game cycle.

Parameters:

first_round (bool) – If True, this is the first round of the game.

get_players_for_cycle()[source]

Gets the current and next player for the game cycle.

Returns:

The current player. Player: The next player.

Return type:

Player

make_player_action(current_player, next_player, action: str)[source]

Makes the player’s action.

Parameters:

  • current_player (Player) – The current player.

  • next_player (Player) – The next player.

  • action (str) – The action chosen by the current player.

show_censor_part(player: Player)[source]

Displays a pause screen between player turns.

Parameters:

player (Player) – The next player.

show_current_player_deck(player: Player)[source]

Displays the current player’s deck and actions.

Parameters:

player (Player) – The current player.

Returns:

The player’s chosen action.

Return type:

str

show_winner(winner: Player)[source]

Displays the winner of the game.

Parameters:

winner (Player) – The winning player.

start()[source]

Starts the game.

Utilities

The utils.py module provides utility functions and classes that support the main game logic, such as color codes for terminal output and unique identifier management.
